title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
(a) Before trade, the relevant curves are the domestic supply curve and the demand curve. The intersection of domestic supply and demand determines the equilibrium price and quantity, P1 and Q3. Consumer surplus is area H, above the price line and below the demand curve. Producer surplus is area I + L + T, above the domestic supply curve and below the price line.

1 point - for identifying Q3 and P1

1 point - for identifying H

1 point - for identifying I+L+T
descriptions:
Student receives 0/3 point(s)

1 point - for identifying Q3 and P1

1 point - for identifying H

1 point - for identifying I+L+T

Student receives 1/3 point(s)

1 point - for identifying Q3 and P1

1 point - for identifying H

1 point - for identifying I+L+T

Student receives 2/3 point(s)

1 point - for identifying Q3 and P1

1 point - for identifying H

1 point - for identifying I+L+T

Student receives 3/3 point(s)

(a) Before trade, the relevant curves are the domestic supply curve and the demand curve. The intersection of domestic supply and demand determines the equilibrium price and quantity, P1 and Q1. Consumer surplus is area H, above the price line and below the demand curve. Producer surplus is area I + L + T, above the domestic supply curve and below the price line.

1 point - for identifying Q3 and P1

1 point - for identifying H

1 point - for identifying I+L+T

title: Part b
stimulusHtml:
(b) With free trade and a world price of PW, domestic suppliers are unable to charge more than PW because consumers can purchase all that they want at the world price. At PW, domestic suppliers are willing to supply quantity Q1 and demanders will purchase quantity Q5. The difference between these quantities, Q5 – Q1, will be imported by Country X.

1 point - for identifying Q5-Q1
descriptions:
Student receives 0/1 point(s)

1 point - for identifying Q5-Q1

Student receives 1/1 point(s)

1 point - for identifying Q5-Q1

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
(c) At the post-tariff price PT, the domestic supply curve indicates that domestic suppliers will produce the quantity Q2 rather than Q1, so the change is Q2 – Q1. The demand curve indicates that domestic consumers will demand the quantity Q4 rather than Q5, so the change is Q4 – Q5. Consumer surplus shrinks from (H+I+J+K+L+M+N+R+S) to (H+I+J+K), a loss of (L+M+N+R+S). Producer surplus increases from T to T+L, a gain of L.

1 for identifying Q2-Q1; Q2 is acceptable if part (b) is correct.

1 for identifying Q4-Q5; Q4 is acceptable if part (b) is correct.

1 for identifying the loss: L+M+N+R+S; (retain H+I+J+K not acceptable—must identify the CHANGE).

1 for identifying the gain: L; (T + L not acceptable—must identify the CHANGE).
